resources.name: Simple Execute
resources.description:
Executes a `queryString` string against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

*This method appears to return the results sets immediately after executing, where the `executeString` and `executeDeploy` only return metadata about the execution and size of the result sets.*

resources.name: Query Execution Service
resources.description:
A collection of requests handled by the pgtoolsservice ConnectionService `ossdbtoolsservice\query_execution\query_execution_service.py`

Here is the table of method strings and associated parameter classes for every registered `IncomingMessageConfiguration` in `query_execution_service.py`:

## query/executeString
- **Class**: ExecuteStringParams
- **Method**: query/executeString
- **Request JSON**:
```json
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "query/executeString",
    "id": 430231,
    "params": {
        "ownerUri": null,
        "executionPlanOptions": {
            "includeActualExecutionPlanXml": false,
            "includeEstimatedExecutionPlanXml": false
        },
        "query": null
    }
}
```

## query/executeDeploy
- **Class**: ExecuteStringParams
- **Method**: query/executeDeploy
- **Request JSON**:
```json
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "query/executeDeploy",
    "id": 572825,
    "params": {
        "ownerUri": null,
        "executionPlanOptions": {
            "includeActualExecutionPlanXml": false,
            "includeEstimatedExecutionPlanXml": false
        },
        "query": null
    }
}
```

    "jsonrpc": "2.0",

    "params": {
        "ownerUri": null,

            "includeActualExecutionPlanXml": false,
            "includeEstimatedExecutionPlanXml": false
        },
        "querySelection": {
            "startLine": 77,
            "startColumn": 29,
            "endLine": 70,
            "endColumn": 46
        }
    }
}
```

        "ownerUri": null,
        "executionPlanOptions": {
            "includeActualExecutionPlanXml": false,
            "includeEstimatedExecutionPlanXml": false
        },
        "line": null,
        "column": null
    }
}
```

resources.name: Requests
resources.description:
A collection of requests that can be executed against the pgtoolsservice.

Results for any given request will be streamed back asynchronously via the `#2 Websocket Connection`. 

***Note*** *Before running requests you must first execute `#1 Start Session` followed by `#2 Websocket Connection`.*

resources.name: Execute String
resources.description: Executes a `query` string against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

resources.name: Execute Deploy
resources.description:
Executes a deploy (`query`) string against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

*Not sure what the difference is between `executeString` and `executeDeploy`. They even take the same `ExecuteStringParams` input.*

resources.name: Query Subset
resources.description:
Retrieves a subset of results from a query executed against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

Subset Defined By:
- `batchIndex`
- `resultSetIndex`
- `rowsStartIndex`
- `rowsCount`

resources.name: Query Cancel
resources.description: Cancels an ongoing query request against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

resources.name: Query Dispose
resources.description: Disposes an executed query request against the postgresql instance associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

resources.name: Connect Postgres
resources.description: Makes a connection to a postgresql instance and associates it with the `owner_uri` provided.

resources.name: Connection Service
List Databases
resources.description: Lists all the databases for the postgresql instance associated with `owner_uri`.

resources.name: Change Database
resources.description: Change database context on the postgresql instance associated with `owner_uri`.

resources.name: Build Connection Info
resources.description:
Builds connection info for the postgresql instance associated with `owner_uri`.

***Note:*** *This method just returns `pass` (true) in the pgtoolsservice as it is not implemented.*

resources.name: Get Connection String
resources.description:
Gets a connection string for the postgresql instance associated with `owner_uri`.

***Note:*** *This method just returns `pass` (true) in the pgtoolsservice as it is not implemented.*

resources.name: Cancel Connect Postgres
resources.description: Cancels an ongoing connection attempt to a postgresql instance and associated with the `owner_uri` provided.

resources.name: Disconnect Postgres
resources.description: Disconnects the postgresql instance identified by `owner_uri`.

resources.name: #2 WebSocket Connect
resources.description:
Establish a WebSocket connection using the session_id in our cookie file from "Start Session"

To complete the connection exexute send `40` on the `Body` tab.

Responses will show up under `Events` to the right.

***Note:*** *You must startup pgtoolsservice with `--enable-web-server` and `--disable-keep-alive` as debugging tools like Insomnia and Postman do not understand the keep alive portion of the SocketIO (WebSocket) protocol. Failure to do so will result in connections getting terminated before any messages can be sent.*

resources.name: #1 Start Session
resources.description: Initiates a connection to the pgtoolservice JRPC server over HTTP and starts a session, the value of which will be stored in a cookie as session_id. This session_id is used to coorelate future requests, as well as associate this client connection with a cooresponding WebSocket connection for asynchronous responses.
